data.title: Improve the supported input gestures of the Actor to support doubletab, fling, swipe gestures etc.
data.body:

Currently the only supported input gestures are down, up and (very simple) drag. Some abstraction should be added to support swipe gestures, doubletaps, confirmed single tabs etc.

data.title: Parallel Action NullPointerException
data.body:
_From [can...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/102115008550572502171/) on February 04, 2011 22:24:35_

stacktrace:
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.actions.Parallel.copy(Unknown Source)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.actions.Forever.act(Unknown Source)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor.act(Unknown Source)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group.act(Unknown Source)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Stage.act(Unknown Source)
    at test.Test.render(Test.java:25)

Can be reproduced with the Test file attached.

I'm using the latest nightly (4 feb), may be it's related with the pool provider, but i couldn't get far because the debugger cannot point to source line number (i suppose debugging data is stripped from nightly, may be it would be better to include them, as lib users can help you spotting/fixing defects)

regards,
   Cani

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=114_

data.title: Add Interpolators to the Actions of Actors
data.body:
_From [moritzp...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/110380137820502036004/) on February 04, 2011 20:56:33_

Currently all Actions (Animations) are performed in a linear fasion. Adding interpolation would make the animation process much  more dynamic.

One could easily add the same funtionality as provided by the android.view.Interpolator implementations.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=113_

data.title: Mpg123 support
data.body:
_From [badlogicgames](https://code.google.com/u/badlogicgames/) on February 04, 2011 14:56:44_

Currently we exclude mpg123 from the builds. Plan: include it again

1) compile binaries for all platforms in shared lib format
2) distribute shared libs
3) let Mpg123Decoder load "mpg123" via GdxNativesLoader.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=112_

data.title: The origin* fields of an Actor should be named pivot*
data.body:
_From [moritzp...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/110380137820502036004/) on February 03, 2011 16:26:04_

From what i understand the originX and originY fields are used to control the rotation axis when setting the rotation. The placement is based on the x and y fields. Therefore it would be clearer to name fields controlling the rotation axis picot points.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=111_

data.body:
_From [aurelien.ribon](https://code.google.com/u/aurelien.ribon/) on February 03, 2011 09:45:10_

Title says it, a getter for the inner JFrame would enable the creation of multi-window application using this backend. Single-window applications are still possible to implement using the Lwjgl backend, but what about Jogl ? ._.

Thanks :-)

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=109_

data.title: Group actors should be more easily sortable
data.body:
_From [moritzp...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/110380137820502036004/) on February 01, 2011 10:14:45_

Currently the Group class in a 2d scene graph allows to add actors at specific positions and to swap actors. Although that covers all requirements it would be very convenient to allow to sort the actors of a group via a Comparator.

Possible via a method like Group.sort(Comparator) which is backed by Collections.sort(children, comparator). Thereby it would not be necessary to expose an unmodifiable version of the children list.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=108_

data.title: The KEYCODE_DPAD_CENTER should point to the numblock "5" on desktop backend
data.body:
_From [moritzp...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/110380137820502036004/) on January 31, 2011 20:44:58_

Currently the 5 returns a KEYCODE_UNKNOWN which is okay but when using an android device one can usually click on the cursor, thereby activating the KEYCODE_DPAD_CENTER. To mimic a similar behavior the "5" should also fire a KEYCODE_DPAD_CENTER event when the numblock is in "cursor mode".

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=107_

data.title: AndroidSound cannot play sound.
No way to handle user canelling text input
data.body:
_From [andrey.o...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/116795291256733549846/) on January 27, 2011 19:30:05_

getTextInput function shows an input box asking user to enter text, and then is supposed to call function named input with entered text as argument, which I am overloading. The problem is that if a person pushes back button on his phone instead of pressing OK, input never gets called, which means that from program's standpoint there is no way to tell if user is still entering text or pressed back long ago. This is a problem.

Using nightly builds from 3-4 days ago.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=105_

What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Load the invaders demo (.81)
2. Put a breakpoint in GdxInvaders.resume()
3. Debug the game.

data.title: BitmapFont clipping
data.body:
_From [andrey.o...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/116795291256733549846/) on January 21, 2011 17:26:40_

Please add an option to clip text drawn by BitmapFont. With Texture and SpriteBatch , we are able to clip pictures we draw on screen by using srcWidth and srcHeight arguments to SpriteBatch .draw, but with text rendering there is no such option. It is very much needed because without it there's no way to make scrollable menu or big text field.

Your libarary is very nice otherwise, thanks for the great work.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=103_

data.title: Jogl Can't Find libopenal.dylib on OSX
data.body:
_From [navar...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/104269842067547605287/) on January 21, 2011 02:52:18_

This problem occurs with the latest nightly binaries (rev. 1390). What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create a class whose main method creates a new JoglApplication. 
2. Add gdx-backend-jogl.jar and gdx-backend-jogl-natives.jar to build path
3. Build and run. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The Jogl backend should load libopenal.dylib from gdx-backend-jogl-natives.jar/native/macosx/libopenal.dylib.  However, the actual path is gdx-backend-jogl-natives.jar/native/macosx/openal.dylib.

This causes the following error:
Exception in thread "main" com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: Creating window failed
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.jogl.JoglApplication.<init>(Unknown Source)
    at com.foo.test.main(test.java:33)
Caused by: java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
    at java.awt.EventQueue.invokeAndWait(EventQueue.java:1034)
    at javax.swing.SwingUtilities.invokeAndWait(SwingUtilities.java:1320)
    ... 2 more
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: couldn't find libopenal.dylib in jar file.
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.jogl.JoglNativesLoader.load(Unknown Source)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.jogl.JoglNativesLoader.loadLibraries(Unknown Source)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.jogl.JoglApplication.initialize(Unknown Source)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.jogl.JoglApplication$1.run(Unknown Source)
    at java.awt.event.InvocationEvent.dispatch(InvocationEvent.java:199)
    at java.awt.EventQueue.dispatchEvent(EventQueue.java:633)
    at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpOneEventForFilters(EventDispatchThread.java:296)
    at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForFilter(EventDispatchThread.java:211)
    at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForHierarchy(EventDispatchThread.java:201)
    at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(EventDispatchThread.java:196)
    at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(EventDispatchThread.java:188)
    at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.run(EventDispatchThread.java:122) What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Using nightly build revision 1390 (downloaded January 19th, 2011), on OSX 10.6.6, using Eclipse Platform Version 3.6.1.r361_v20100909-9gF78GrkFqw7GrsZnvz0JWNTeb6fue6896L, with Build id: M20100909-0800. Please provide any additional information below.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=102_

data.title: ContactListener misses PreSolve and PostSolve methods
data.body:
_From [Martin.G...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/108099821330522296291/) on January 20, 2011 09:18:43_

See e.g.: http://code.google.com/p/box2d/source/browse/trunk/Box2D/Box2D/Dynamics/b2WorldCallbacks.h these two methods are missing, but they are useful to e.g. determine the force with which the collide is done. (the normalImpulse of the b2Manifold - which is missing, too)

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=101_

data.title: Version number in jar files
data.body:
_From [ariel.co...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/103999810929932499370/) on January 19, 2011 13:27:16_

It is really useful to have the version number attached to the jar file, like gdx-0.81.jar for example, to easily detect which version I am running when a bug is found, or an API difference (if following a tutorial for example), etc. It is a common practice used by apache projects, for example apache beanutils: http://commons.apache.org/beanutils/download_beanutils.cgi For nightly builds you could use gdx-0.82-nightly or gdx-0.82-SNAPSHOT if you want to follow maven nomenclature.

Cons: if you import by hand your project dependencies, you will have to change by hand each time you change the jars of libgdx, but if you use eclipse or other ides to import all jars in /somefolder (most common /libs), then you don't have this problem.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=100_

data.title: Input.isTouched() broken on Desktop
data.body:
_From [xtophena...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/106188873643963298482/) on January 18, 2011 11:40:11_

What steps will reproduce the problem? It appears Input.isTouched() is broken in the latest nightly build on desktop. Android is working fine. Input.isTouched() correctly returns false initially, goes to true when a mouse button is pressed but does not go back to false when the button is released. Input.isTouched() stays on true after the initial button click. Everything else appears to be working fine. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Nightly Build 1/18/2010. Broken for Desktop. OK on Android.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=99_

data.title: Sequence Copy/Finish-Issue
data.body:
_From [thomas.t...@googlemail.com](https://code.google.com/u/110759639387810803479/) on January 18, 2011 03:09:46_

What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create a Sequence inside a Forever-Action. In my example I wanted an Image to ScaleUp and down all the time. It made: ScaleUp,Down,Up and from that point stopped scaling.

e.g.:
anyactor.action(Forever.$(Sequence.$(ScaleTo.$(1.1f, 1.1f,0.3f),ScaleTo.$(1f, 1f, 0.3f))));

The problem was the copy-mechanism of Sequence. Sequence called the finish()-method of every included action that is done. That is okay aslong you don't want to restart/copy the sequence.

When ScaleTo obtains an unused ScaleTo-Action it retrieves the last finished action(which is still referenced in the sequence) (in my case the ScaleTo(1,1,0.3)) and sets the new values for the first ScaleTo of the Sequence (in this case ScaleTo(1.1,1.1,0.3))
When the scale adds the second ScaleTo the values are already corrupted and the whole Sequence is trapped at the 1.1,1.1-Values.

I know wrote it confuse but it was a very mind blowing debugging :D

To make the long story short, the Sequence's child-actions are now finished at the time the Sequence is finished. That solved at least my problem. BTW: What is about that $ as a method-name! Is that something special? Never saw that before :D What is the expected output? What do you see instead? What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Please provide any additional information below.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=98_

data.title: Default external storage path
data.body:
_From [adamwbr...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/105008755683110208773/) on January 17, 2011 19:23:20_

I was just noticing that since API level 8 (2.2) they support a nice feature of hoping and wishing developers use the following path for writing app specific files:

```
/Android/data/<package_name>/files/
```

And during an uninstall, they will automatically remove that directory and it's contents.

So I was thinking it might be nice to use this as some sort of default when reading/writing to external storage. Both as a nice "good defaults = less work" and as a way of gently nudging people toward best practices.

It's detailed here: http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/data/data-storage.html#filesExternal Related forum post here: http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=336

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=97_

data.title: Support for the live wallpaper
data.body:
_From [to.wan...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/103495398839381203885/) on January 13, 2011 13:01:49_

Now I'm do a job to create an Android application that can run in standalone mode or live wallpaper mode. So I've an idea to extend libgdx to support live wallpaper. I have to do the following things to achieve that:
1). Borrow the code from Robert Green ( http://www.rbgrn.net/content/354-glsurfaceview-adapted-3d-live-wallpapers ). Though his code has big overlap with android GLSurfaceView, he really did a lot of test and hack on different devices. His code will be the base class.
2). I have to change some method parameters in AndroidGraphics, AndroidInput,AndroidAudio etc which only accept AndroidApplication object.
3). Create the AndroidLivewallpaper as a parallel to AndroidfApplication, which extends the GLSurfaceView. It will do the actual work to support live wallpaper and libgdx core engine.

How about the idea? Should it the best way to do it?

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=95_

data.title: MD5Mesh/Animation serializable + MD5 pingpong wraptype + clear-stage
data.body:
_From [thomas.t...@googlemail.com](https://code.google.com/u/110759639387810803479/) on January 11, 2011 00:03:43_

Hola here a patch for the 3 different issues.

1) Serialization. 
Just added 'implements Serializable' and a default serialVersionUID
2) Ping Pong + AnimationDirection
I modified the Animator-Class. Now there are 3 different WRAPMODES:
WRAPTYPE_LOOP,WRAPTYPE_CLAMP,WRAPTYPE_PINGPONG 
LOOP and CLAMP were implemented before I added PINGPONG which changes the direction back to the start where it changes again (framecount like this: 1234321234...)

And as I needed it for the pingpong you now can change the animation-direction as well! Don't have a real usecase for this know, but some creative people might need it ;D. You can change the direction with setAnimationDirection(ANIMDIR_FORWARD/ANIMDIR_BACKWARD). I hope there are no sideeffect with die KeyframedModel. I didn't know exactly what it is for but it should be fine.

3) I need a way to clear the whole stage! there for I added in Group a method removeActors() which clears groups and actors list. This method is called by the clearStage() method in stage!

Hope, the changes are ok for you and sry for creating one issue for actually three...ToM

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=93_

data.title: Black screen in loading gdxtest as well as gdx-helloworld
data.body:
_From [mewf...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/114694344940924760515/) on January 09, 2011 03:53:31_

What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. connect phone to pc with usb debugging
2. change to sleep mode by pressing power button
3. start the project(s) in eclipse to run in the device
4. press power button to return from sleep mode What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected: both program run fine as it is
Instead what I saw is black screen, back button etc all no response What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? latest version from svn Please provide any additional information below. I am not sure if this is a problem only in the case mentioned, if it is, it may not be important (programs won't run in sleep mode except usb debug). However, I am concerned whether this bug may appear on some other cases.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=92_

data.title: Build & Compile for Mac Snow Leopard 10.6.5 64bit
data.body:
_From [to.wan...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/103495398839381203885/) on January 07, 2011 05:22:43_

This is my Mac
Darwin MacBook-Pro.local 10.5.0 Darwin Kernel Version 10.5.0: Fri Nov  5 23:20:39 PDT 2010; root:xnu-1504.9.17~1/RELEASE_I386 i386

The goal is to make the ant script can build universal Mac dynamic library: libgdx.dylib & libgdx-64.dylib. (Both are universal).

Two new build files are added to do compile & link. 

I tested it on my Mac and it works fine. The resulting libgdx.dylib can support all test cases except those related with Shaders. I think it may be a bug in other places.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=91_
